Verse: And the second is equally important: ‘Love your neighbor as yourself.’
A troublemaker plants seeds of strife; gossip separates the best of friends.
A friend is always loyal, and a brother is born to help in time of need.
Gentle words are a tree of life; a deceitful tongue crushes the spirit.
A glad heart makes a happy face; a broken heart crushes the spirit.
A hot-tempered person starts fights; a cool-tempered person stops them.
A cheerful heart is good medicine, but a broken spirit saps a person’s strength.
There are “friends” who destroy each other, but a real friend sticks closer than a brother.
So now I am giving you a new commandment: Love each other. Just as I have loved you, you should love each other. Your love for one another will prove to the world that you are my disciples.
A gentle answer deflects anger, but harsh words make tempers flare.
Most important of all, continue to show deep love for each other, for love covers a multitude of sins.

In his kindness God called you to share in his eternal glory by means of Christ Jesus. So after you have suffered a little while, he will restore, support, and strengthen you, and he will place you on a firm foundation.
And be sure of this: I am with you always, even to the end of the age.
Jesus replied, “‘You must love the Lord your God with all your heart, all your soul, and all your mind.’ This is the first and greatest commandment.
And this hope will not lead to disappointment. For we know how dearly God loves us, because he has given us the Holy Spirit to fill our hearts with his love.

Now I am departing from the world; they are staying in this world, but I am coming to you. Holy Father, you have given me your name; now protect them by the power of your name so that they will be united just as we are.
And I am certain that God, who began the good work within you, will continue his work until it is finally finished on the day when Christ Jesus returns.
I will walk in freedom, for I have devoted myself to your commandments.
And this same God who takes care of me will supply all your needs from his glorious riches, which have been given to us in Christ Jesus.
And the King will say, ‘I tell you the truth, when you did it to one of the least of these my brothers and sisters, you were doing it to me!’
And this is the way to have eternal life—to know you, the only true God, and Jesus Christ, the one you sent to earth.
And we know that God causes everything to work together for the good of those who love God and are called according to his purpose for them.
And you will know the truth, and the truth will set you free.
Worry weighs a person down; an encouraging word cheers a person up.
As a face is reflected in water, so the heart reflects the real person.
Keep on asking, and you will receive what you ask for. Keep on seeking, and you will find. Keep on knocking, and the door will be opened to you.
Instead, be kind to each other, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, just as God through Christ has forgiven you.
Be still in the presence of the Lord, and wait patiently for him to act. Don’t worry about evil people who prosper or fret about their wicked schemes.
So be strong and courageous, all you who put your hope in the Lord!
Your unfailing love is better than life itself; how I praise you!
I used to wander off until you disciplined me; but now I closely follow your word.
But the Lord watches over those who fear him, those who rely on his unfailing love.
Dear friends, let us continue to love one another, for love comes from God. Anyone who loves is a child of God and knows God.
Better to have little, with godliness, than to be rich and dishonest.
Let all that I am praise the Lord; may I never forget the good things he does for me. He forgives all my sins and heals all my diseases.
Bless those who persecute you. Don’t curse them; pray that God will bless them.
God blesses those who are merciful, for they will be shown mercy.
God blesses those who work for peace, for they will be called the children of God.
God blesses those who are poor and realize their need for him, for the Kingdom of Heaven is theirs.
God blesses those whose hearts are pure, for they will see God.
God blesses those who are persecuted for doing right, for the Kingdom of Heaven is theirs.
God blesses those who hunger and thirst for justice, for they will be satisfied.
God blesses those who mourn, for they will be comforted.

God blesses you when people mock you and persecute you and lie about you and say all sorts of evil things against you because you are my followers. Be happy about it! Be very glad! For a great reward awaits you in heaven. And remember, the ancient prophets were persecuted in the same way.

All praise to God, the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ. God is our merciful Father and the source of all comfort. He comforts us in all our troubles so that we can comfort others. When they are troubled, we will be able to give them the same comfort God has given us.
But God showed his great love for us by sending Christ to die for us while we were still sinners.
Each time he said, “My grace is all you need. My power works best in weakness.” So now I am glad to boast about my weaknesses, so that the power of Christ can work through me.
But I will call on God, and the Lord will rescue me. Morning, noon, and night I cry out in my distress, and the Lord hears my voice.
But I say, love your enemies! Pray for those who persecute you!
But I am trusting you, O Lord, saying, “You are my God!” My future is in your hands. Rescue me from those who hunt me down relentlessly.
Instead, you must worship Christ as Lord of your life. And if someone asks about your hope as a believer, always be ready to explain it.
Jesus looked at them intently and said, “Humanly speaking, it is impossible. But with God everything is possible.”
Seek the Kingdom of God above all else, and live righteously, and he will give you everything you need.
But the Holy Spirit produces this kind of fruit in our lives: love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faithfulness, gentleness, and self-control. There is no law against these things!
But those who trust in the Lord will find new strength. They will soar high on wings like eagles. They will run and not grow weary. They will walk and not faint.
But to all who believed him and accepted him, he gave the right to become children of God.
But I will send you the Advocate—the Spirit of truth. He will come to you from the Father and will testify all about me.
But when you pray, go away by yourself, shut the door behind you, and pray to your Father in private. Then your Father, who sees everything, will reward you.

But you are not like that, for you are a chosen people. You are royal priests, a holy nation, God’s very own possession. As a result, you can show others the goodness of God, for he called you out of the darkness into his wonderful light.
But you, O Lord, are a God of compassion and mercy, slow to get angry and filled with unfailing love and faithfulness.
But you, O Lord, are a shield around me; you are my glory, the one who holds my head high.
Give your burdens to the Lord, and he will take care of you. He \tHe will not permit the godly to slip and fall.
Give all your worries and cares to God, for he cares about you.
Then Jesus said, “Come to me, all of you who are weary and carry heavy burdens, and I will give you rest.

Then Jesus said, “Come to me, all of you who are weary and carry heavy burdens, and I will give you rest. Take my yoke upon you. Let me teach you, because I am humble and gentle at heart, and you will find rest for your souls.
Come, my children, and listen to me, and I will teach you to fear the Lord.
Commit everything you do to the Lord. Trust him, and he will help you.
Commit your actions to the Lord, and your plans will succeed.
Dear brothers and sisters, when troubles of any kind come your way, consider it an opportunity for great joy. For you know that when your faith is tested, your endurance has a chance to grow.
Create in me a clean heart, O God. Renew a loyal spirit within me.
The tongue can bring death or life; those who love to talk will reap the consequences.
Take delight in the Lord, and he will give you your heart’s desires.

Don’t worry about anything; instead, pray about everything. Tell God what you need, and thank him for all he has done. Then you will experience God’s peace, which exceeds anything we can understand. His peace will guard your hearts and minds as you live in Christ Jesus.

Don’t copy the behavior and customs of this world, but let God transform you into a new person by changing the way you think. Then you will learn to know God’s will for you, which is good and pleasing and perfect.
Don’t let evil conquer you, but conquer evil by doing good.

Don’t store up treasures here on earth, where moths eat them and rust destroys them, and where thieves break in and steal. Store your treasures in heaven, where moths and rust cannot destroy, and thieves do not break in and steal.
Don’t repay evil with evil. Don’t retaliate with insults when people insult you. Instead, bless them, because to this you were called so that you may inherit a blessing.
Don’t be selfish; don’t try to impress others. Be humble, thinking of others as better than yourselves. Don’t look out only for your own interests, but take an interest in others, too.
Work hard so you can present yourself to God and receive his approval. Be a good worker, one who does not need to be ashamed and who correctly explains the word of truth.
A tree is identified by its fruit. If a tree is good, its fruit will be good. If a tree is bad, its fruit will be bad.
Even when I walk through the darkest valley, I will not be afraid, for you are close beside me. Your rod and your staff protect and comfort me.
Anyone who listens to my teaching and follows it is wise, like a person who builds a house on solid rock.
Don’t be afraid, for I am with you. Don’t be discouraged, for I am your God. I will strengthen you and help you. I will hold you up with my victorious right hand.
A final word: Be strong in the Lord and in his mighty power.

And now, dear brothers and sisters, one final thing. Fix your thoughts on what is true, and honorable, and right, and pure, and lovely, and admirable. Think about things that are excellent and worthy of praise.
God saved you by his grace when you believed. And you can’t take credit for this; it is a gift from God. Salvation is not a reward for the good things we have done, so none of us can boast about it.
I wait quietly before God, for my victory comes from him. He alone is my rock and my salvation, my fortress where I will never be shaken.
For God has not given us a spirit of fear and timidity, but of power, love, and self-discipline.
For this is how God loved the world: He gave his one and only Son, so that everyone who believes in him will not perish but have eternal life.
His anger lasts only a moment, but his favor lasts a lifetime! Weeping may last through the night, but joy comes with the morning.

And I am convinced that nothing can ever separate us from God’s love. Neither death nor life, neither angels nor demons, neither our fears for today nor our worries about tomorrow—not even the powers of hell can separate us from God’s love. No power in the sky above or in the earth below—indeed, nothing in all creation will ever be able to separate us from the love of God that is revealed in Christ Jesus our Lord.
Yet what we suffer now is nothing compared to the glory he will reveal to us later.
For I know the plans I have for you,” says the Lord. “They are plans for good and not for disaster, to give you a future and a hope.
If you forgive those who sin against you, your heavenly Father will forgive you. But if you refuse to forgive others, your Father will not forgive your sins.

“My thoughts are nothing like your thoughts,” says the Lord. “And my ways are far beyond anything you could imagine. For just as the heavens are higher than the earth, so my ways are higher than your ways and my thoughts higher than your thoughts.
For the Lord grants wisdom! From his mouth come knowledge and understanding.
The godly may trip seven times, but they will get up again. But one disaster is enough to overthrow the wicked.
For the wages of sin is death, but the free gift of God is eternal life through Christ Jesus our Lord.
For God knew his people in advance, and he chose them to become like his Son, so that his Son would be the firstborn among many brothers and sisters.
For we live by believing and not by seeing.
For where two or three gather together as my followers, I am there among them.
You are my rock and my fortress. For the honor of your name, lead me and guide me.
So you have not received a spirit that makes you fearful slaves. Instead, you received God’s Spirit when he adopted you as his own children. Now we call him, “Abba, Father.”
Your eternal word, O Lord, stands firm in heaven.
God is our refuge and strength, always ready to help in times of trouble.
Discretion is a life-giving fountain to those who possess it, but discipline is wasted on fools.
Sensible people control their temper; they earn respect by overlooking wrongs.
Kind words are like honey—sweet to the soul and healthy for the body.
Gray hair is a crown of glory; it is gained by living a godly life.
Those who love your instructions have great peace and do not stumble.
There is no greater love than to lay down one’s life for one’s friends.
Hatred stirs up quarrels, but love makes up for all offenses.
This is my command—be strong and courageous! Do not be afraid or discouraged. For the Lord your God is with you wherever you go.
He heals the brokenhearted and bandages their wounds.

A third time he asked him, “Simon son of John, do you love me?” Peter was hurt that Jesus asked the question a third time. He said, “Lord, you know everything. You know that I love you.” Jesus said, “Then feed my sheep.
Since he did not spare even his own Son but gave him up for us all, won’t he also give us everything else?
Those who live in the shelter of the Most High will find rest in the shadow of the Almighty. This I declare about the Lord: He alone is my refuge, my place of safety; he is my God, and I trust him.
Honor the Lord with your wealth and with the best part of everything you produce. Then he will fill your barns with grain, and your vats will overflow with good wine.
Hope deferred makes the heart sick, but a dream fulfilled is a tree of life.
How can a young person stay pure? By obeying your word.
How much better to get wisdom than gold, and good judgment than silver!
So humble yourselves under the mighty power of God, and at the right time he will lift you up in honor.
Yes, I am the vine; you are the branches. Those who remain in me, and I in them, will produce much fruit. For apart from me you can do nothing.

And so, dear brothers and sisters, I plead with you to give your bodies to God because of all he has done for you. Let them be a living and holy sacrifice—the kind he will find acceptable. This is truly the way to worship him.
For I can do everything through Christ, who gives me strength.

I am praying not only for these disciples but also for all who will ever believe in me through their message. I pray that they will all be one, just as you and I are one—as you are in me, Father, and I am in you. And may they be in us so that the world will believe you sent me.
I have chosen to be faithful; I have determined to live by your regulations.

John 16:33 I have told you all this so that you may have peace in me. Here on earth you will have many trials and sorrows. But take heart, because I have overcome the world.
I know the Lord is always with me. I will not be shaken, for he is right beside me.
I have hidden your word in my heart, that I might not sin against you.
I look up to the mountains—does my help come from there? My help comes from the Lord, who made heaven and earth!
Thank you for making me so wonderfully complex! Your workmanship is marvelous—how well I know it.
I prayed to the Lord, and he answered me. He freed me from all my fears.
I am counting on the Lord; yes, I am counting on him. I have put my hope in his word.

I waited patiently for the Lord to help me, and he turned to me and heard my cry. He lifted me out of the pit of despair, out of the mud and the mire. He set my feet on solid ground and steadied me as I walked along.
The Lord says, “I will guide you along the best pathway for your life. I will advise you and watch over you.
I will study your commandments and reflect on your ways.
I will never forget your commandments, for by them you give me life.
If the world hates you, remember that it hated me firstJNI
But if you remain in me and my words remain in you, you may ask for anything you want, and it will be granted!
If you love me, obey my commandments.
In the same way, let your good deeds shine out for all to see, so that everyone will praise your heavenly Father.
Better to be poor and humble than to be arrogant and rich.
My suffering was good for me, for it taught me to pay attention to your decrees.
Jesus replied, “I tell you the truth, unless you are born again, you cannot see the Kingdom of God.”
Jesus replied, “All who love me will do what I say. My Father will love them, and we will come and make our home with each of them.

Jesus told her, “I am the resurrection and the life. Anyone who believes in me will live, even after dying. Everyone who lives in me and believes in me will never ever die. Do you believe this, Martha?”
Jesus told him, “I am the way, the truth, and the life. No one can come to the Father except through me.
Then Jesus told him, “You believe because you have seen me. Blessed are those who believe without seeing me.”
Guide my steps by your word, so I will not be overcome by evil.
Guard your heart above all else, for it determines the course of your life.
Lead me by your truth and teach me, for you are the God who saves me. All day long I put my hope in you.
And do everything with love.
Don’t just pretend to love others. Really love them. Hate what is wrong. Hold tightly to what is good.
Don’t use foul or abusive language. Let everything you say be good and helpful, so that your words will be an encouragement to those who hear them.

Never let loyalty and kindness leave you! Tie them around your neck as a reminder. Write them deep within your heart. Then you will find favor with both God and people, and you will earn a good reputation.
Don’t let your hearts be troubled. Trust in God, and trust also in me.
And may the Lord our God show us his approval and make our efforts successful. Yes, make our efforts successful!
May the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart be pleasing to you, O Lord, my rock and my redeemer.
Now let your unfailing love comfort me, just as you promised me, your servant.
And the Holy Spirit helps us in our weakness. For example, we don’t know what God wants us to pray for. But the Holy Spirit prays for us with groanings that cannot be expressed in words.
So be careful how you live. Don’t live like fools, but like those who are wise. Make the most of every opportunity in these evil days.
Love does no wrong to others, so love fulfills the requirements of God’s law.

Love is patient and kind. Love is not jealous or boastful or proud or rude. It does not demand its own way. It is not irritable, and it keeps no record of being wronged. It does not rejoice about injustice but rejoices whenever the truth wins out. Love never gives up, never loses faith, is always hopeful, and endures through every circumstance.
Love the Lord, all you godly ones! For the Lord protects those who are loyal to him, but he harshly punishes the arrogant.
The righteous person faces many troubles, but the Lord comes to the rescue each time.
You can make many plans, but the Lord’s purpose will prevail.

May God, who gives this patience and encouragement, help you live in complete harmony with each other, as is fitting for followers of Christ Jesus. Then all of you can join together with one voice, giving praise and glory to God, the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.
I pray that God, the source of hope, will fill you completely with joy and peace because you trust in him. Then you will overflow with confident hope through the power of the Holy Spirit.
My health may fail, and my spirit may grow weak, but God remains the strength of my heart; he is mine forever.
My child, don’t reject the Lord’s discipline, and don’t be upset when he corrects you. For the Lord corrects those he loves, just as a father corrects a child in whom he delights.
I am worn out from sobbing, but I will be strengthened by your word.
No one can serve two masters. For you will hate one and love the other; you will be devoted to one and despise the other. You cannot serve both God and money.

The temptations in your life are no different from what others experience. And God is faithful. He will not allow the temptation to be more than you can stand. When you are tempted, he will show you a way out so that you can endure.
No, despite all these things, overwhelming victory is ours through Christ, who loved us.

We can rejoice, too, when we run into problems and trials, for we know that they help us develop endurance. And endurance develops strength of character, and character strengthens our confident hope of salvation.
Faith shows the reality of what we hope for; it is the evidence of things we cannot see.
Now all glory to God, who is able, through his mighty power at work within us, to accomplish infinitely more than we might ask or think.
Oh, how I love your instructions! I think about them all day long.
How great is the goodness you have stored up for those who fear you. You lavish it on those who come to you for protection, blessing them before the watching world.
Taste and see that the Lord is good. Oh, the joys of those who take refuge in him!
Open my eyes to see the wonderful truths in your instructions.
Owe nothing to anyone—except for your obligation to love one another. If you love your neighbor, you will fulfill the requirements of God’s law.
I am leaving you with a gift—peace of mind and heart. And the peace I give is a gift the world cannot give. So don’t be troubled or afraid.
Pray in the Spirit at all times and on every occasion. Stay alert and be persistent in your prayers for all believers everywhere.
Pride goes before destruction, and haughtiness before a fall.
Put on all of God’s armor so that you will be able to stand firm against all strategies of the devil.
Always be joyful. Never stop praying. Be thankful in all circumstances, for this is God’s will for you who belong to Christ Jesus.
Rejoice in our confident hope. Be patient in trouble, and keep on praying.
Be happy with those who are happy, and weep with those who weep.
Remember the wonders he has performed, his miracles, and the rulings he has given.
Never pay back evil with more evil. Do things in such a way that everyone can see you are honorable. Do all that you can to live in peace with everyone.
The king is pleased with words from righteous lips; he loves those who speak honestly.
Make them holy by your truth; teach them your word, which is truth.
So you have sorrow now, but I will see you again; then you will rejoice, and no one can rob you of that joy.
So faith comes from hearing, that is, hearing the Good News about Christ.
So then, let us aim for harmony in the church and try to build each other up.
Do to others whatever you would like them to do to you. This is the essence of all that is taught in the law and the prophets.
She is clothed with strength and dignity, and she laughs without fear of the future.
You will be rewarded for this; your hope will not be disappointed.
Take my yoke upon you. Let me teach you, because I am humble and gentle at heart, and you will find rest for your souls. For my yoke is easy to bear, and the burden I give you is light.

I pray that from his glorious, unlimited resources he will empower you with inner strength through his Spirit. Then Christ will make his home in your hearts as you trust in him. Your roots will grow down into God’s love and keep you strong.
Getting wisdom is the wisest thing you can do! And whatever else you do, develop good judgment.
Fire tests the purity of silver and gold, but the Lord tests the heart.
If you listen to constructive criticism, you will be at home among the wise.
The eyes of the Lord watch over those who do right; his ears are open to their cries for help.
The fear of the Lord teaches wisdom; humility precedes honor.
The God of peace will soon crush Satan under your feet. The grace of our Lord Jesus be with you.
We can make our plans, but the Lord determines our steps.
The Lord is far from the wicked, but he hears the prayers of the righteous.
The Lord is good to everyone. He showers compassion on all his creation.
The Lord is my light and my salvation—so why should I be afraid? The Lord is my fortress, protecting me from danger, so why should I tremble?
The Lord is my rock, my fortress, and my savior; my God is my rock, in whom I find protection. He is my shield, the power that saves me, and my place of safety.
The Lord is my shepherd; I have all that I need.
The Lord is my strength and shield. I trust him with all my heart. He helps me, and my heart is filled with joy. I burst out in songs of thanksgiving.
The Lord is close to the brokenhearted; he rescues those whose spirits are crushed.
The Lord will work out his plans for my life—for your faithful love, O Lord, endures forever. Don’t abandon me, for you made me.
The name of the Lord is a strong fortress; the godly run to him and are safe.
True humility and fear of the Lord lead to riches, honor, and long life.
The godly walk with integrity; blessed are their children who follow them.
The very essence of your words is truth; all your just regulations will stand forever.
The thief’s purpose is to steal and kill and destroy. My purpose is to give them a rich and satisfying life.
The teaching of your word gives light, so even the simple can understand.
A wise woman builds her home, but a foolish woman tears it down with her own hands.
Then Jesus said to his disciples, “If any of you wants to be my follower, you must give up your own way, take up your cross, and follow me.
So now there is no condemnation for those who belong to Christ Jesus.

Imitate God, therefore, in everything you do, because you are his dear children. Live a life filled with love, following the example of Christ. He loved us and offered himself as a sacrifice for us, a pleasing aroma to God.
So don’t worry about tomorrow, for tomorrow will bring its own worries. Today’s trouble is enough for today.
Therefore, accept each other just as Christ has accepted you so that God will be given glory.
I have told you these things so that you will be filled with my joy. Yes, your joy will overflow!
Your promise revives me; it comforts me in all my troubles.
This is my commandment: Love each other in the same way I have loved you.
This is the day the Lord has made. We will rejoice and be glad in it.

You love him even though you have never seen him. Though you do not see him now, you trust him; and you rejoice with a glorious, inexpressible joy. The reward for trusting him will be the salvation of your souls.
Everyone enjoys a fitting reply; it is wonderful to say the right thing at the right time!
Direct your children onto the right path, and when they are older, they will not leave it.
As pressure and stress bear down on me, I find joy in your commands.
Trust in the Lord with all your heart; do not depend on your own understanding. Seek his will in all you do, and he will show you which path to take.
Turn my eyes from worthless things, and give me life through your word.
You haven’t done this before. Ask, using my name, and you will receive, and you will have abundant joy.
Wait patiently for the Lord. Be brave and courageous. Yes, wait patiently for the Lord.
What shall we say about such wonderful things as these? If God is for us, who can ever be against us?

Work willingly at whatever you do, as though you were working for the Lord rather than for people. Remember that the Lord will give you an inheritance as your reward, and that the Master you are serving is Christ.
When people’s lives please the Lord, even their enemies are at peace with them.
I pondered the direction of my life, and I turned to follow your laws.
Pride leads to disgrace, but with humility comes wisdom.
When doubts filled my mind, your comfort gave me renewed hope and cheer.
The Lord hears his people when they call to him for help. He rescues them from all their troubles.
When the Spirit of truth comes, he will guide you into all truth. He will not speak on his own but will tell you what he has heard. He will tell you about the future.
The generous will prosper; those who refresh others will themselves be refreshed.
Those who listen to instruction will prosper; those who trust the Lord will be joyful.
People with understanding control their anger; a hot temper shows great foolishness.
Better to be patient than powerful; better to have self-control than to conquer a city.
Whoever pursues righteousness and unfailing love will find life, righteousness, and honor.
Walk with the wise and become wise; associate with fools and get in trouble.
Why am I discouraged? Why is my heart so sad? I will put my hope in God! I will praise him again—my Savior and my God!

Always be humble and gentle. Be patient with each other, making allowance for each other’s faults because of your love. Make every effort to keep yourselves united in the Spirit, binding yourselves together with peace.
Plans go wrong for lack of advice; many advisers bring success.
You are my refuge and my shield; your word is my source of hope.
You are the light of the world—like a city on a hilltop that cannot be hidden.
You didn’t choose me. I chose you. I appointed you to go and produce lasting fruit, so that the Father will give you whatever you ask for, using my name.
You will keep in perfect peace all who trust in you, all whose thoughts are fixed on you!
You made me; you created me. Now give me the sense to follow your commands.
Your word is a lamp to guide my feet and a light for my path.
